definitions.definition: fighting or a fight, especially during a time of war

examples.text: Knightly combats were only a very small part of medieval warfare.
Our platoon has yet to see combat.
The soldiers are in combat with rebel forces.
The troops were locked in hand-to-hand combat.
a fierce combat between two champions
Hardly any enemy combat aircraft have been destroyed.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (originally denoting a fight between two people or parties): from French combattre (verb), from late Latin combattere, from com- ‘together with’ + battere, variant of Latin batuere ‘to fight’.
